benchmark_details.name: MDBench (Multi-Document Reasoning Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MDBench is a new benchmark for evaluating LLMs on multi-document reasoning tasks, generated through a synthetic process that enables the creation of challenging question-answer examples based on structured knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the capabilities of large language models in multi-document reasoning and to provide a scalable approach to benchmark generation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation framework is primarily focused on multi-document reasoning and may not encompass all reasoning tasks.

data.source: The benchmark is generated from structured seed knowledge sourced from tabular data, specifically the TabFact dataset, which comprises tables from Wikipedia.
data.annotation: Automatically validated with human-validated examples to ensure quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparison of model predictions against ground-truth answers, using a scoring mechanism for accuracy assessments.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities across multi-document QA tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark examples undergo a multi-step validation process integrating automated checks for quality and internal consistency.
